summary: This document is an email chain from May 2021 between Katya Jestin, Co-Managing Partner of Jenner & Block LLP, and an unidentified recipient. The emails discuss scheduling a call to follow up on an unspecified question, with Jestin indicating she is available. The document appears to be routine professional correspondence.

persons.name: Katya Jestin
persons.context: She is the sender/author of the emails, following up on a question with an unidentified recipient and offering to schedule a call.

events.title: Initial follow-up email
events.description: Katya Jestin sends an initial email following up on a question she had asked an unidentified recipient.

events.title: Recipient requests call
events.description: An unidentified recipient emails Katya Jestin requesting a call, stating they are free that evening.

events.title: Jestin responds to schedule call
events.description: Katya Jestin responds to the recipient's email, apologizing for missing it, stating she is available, and asking when a good time would be to connect.

keyFacts: The correspondence is from May 2021, years after Jeffrey Epstein's death in 2019.
Katya Jestin, a senior partner at the law firm Jenner & Block LLP, is communicating with an unidentified recipient about an unspecified question.
The email chain is brief and appears to be about scheduling a professional call, with no direct mention of Epstein, his associates, or the case in the provided text.
The document includes a standard confidentiality warning, indicating it may contain privileged information.
The recipient's identity and the subject of the 'question' are redacted or not provided in the text.
